overview: From 2026-02-15 to 2026-02-22, elizaos-plugins/registry had 6 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topIssues.title: claude-review workflow failing (missing id-token: write)
topIssues.author: kamiyo-ai
topIssues.body:
On PRs the `claude-review` check fails with:

`Could not fetch an OIDC token. Did you remember to add id-token: write to your workflow permissions?`

This blocks otherwise-valid registry PRs. Suggest adding:

```yaml
permissions:
  id-token: write
  contents: read
  pull-requests: write
```

or configuring the action with an explicit `github_token` so it does not rely on OIDC.

topPRs.title: Add @elizaos/plugin-said ‚Äî SAID Protocol on-chain Solana identity
topPRs.author: kaiclawd
topPRs.body:
Adds `@elizaos/plugin-said` to the ElizaOS plugin registry. **Repo:** https://github.com/kaiclawd/plugin-said Every ElizaOS agent using this plugin gets a free on-chain Solana identity via SAID Protocol on first run. Zero new dependencies, fully opt-in, non-blocking. ```json { "plugins": ["@elizaos/plugin-said"] } ``` ‚Üí Agent gets Solana keypair + SAID identity at [saidprotocol.com/agents](https://saidprotocol.com/agents) ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Style** * Adjusted code formatting in configuration file.

Greptile Summary

Adds `@elizaos/plugin-said` to the plugin registry, mapping it to `github:kaiclawd/plugin-said`. The new entry follows the `@elizaos/` namespace convention used by many third-party plugins and is correctly placed in alphabetical order between `plugin-safe` and `plugin-sei`. - The only functional change is the addition of one new registry entry on line 181 - The diff appears large (244 lines changed) because the PR also reformats the entire file's indentation from 3 spaces to 2 spaces ‚Äî this is cosmetic and does not affect any other entries - No existing entries were removed or modified (entry count went from 241 ‚Üí 242)

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is safe to merge ‚Äî it only adds a single registry entry with no logic changes. - The functional change is minimal (one new JSON key-value pair) and follows existing patterns. The entry is correctly alphabetized. Score is 4 instead of 5 due to the unnecessary whitespace reformatting that makes the diff harder to review and could cause merge conflicts with other pending PRs. - No files require special attention beyond the noted indentation change in `index.json`.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Adds `@elizaos/plugin-said` entry pointing to `github:kaiclawd/plugin-said`. Entry is correctly placed in alphabetical order. Indentation was changed from 3 spaces to 2 spaces across the entire file, inflating the diff unnecessarily. |

Flowchart

```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'neutral'}}%% flowchart TD A["index.json\n(Plugin Registry)"] -->|"push to main"| B["generate-registry-json.yml\n(GitHub Action)"] B --> C["scripts/generate-registry.js"] C -->|"reads index.json"| A C -->|"fetches metadata from"| D["GitHub API\n(kaiclawd/plugin-said)"] C -->|"checks npm"| E["npm Registry\n(@elizaos/plugin-said)"] C -->|"writes"| F["generated-registry.json"] style A fill:#f9f,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px style D fill:#bbf,stroke:#333 style E fill:#bbf,stroke:#333 ``` Last reviewed commit: cd5fffc (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: feat: add @buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd ‚Äî SolCex Exchange BD plugin
topPRs.author: buzzbysolcex
topPRs.body:
## Plugin: @buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd **Repository:** https://github.com/buzzbysolcex/plugin-solcex-bd **npm:** https://www.npmjs.com/package/@buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd ### Description SolCex Exchange Business Development plugin for ElizaOS. Autonomous token discovery, scoring, and listing pipeline management. ### Features - üîç Token Discovery via DexScreener API (search, trending, boosted tokens) - üìä 100-Point Scoring Engine (liquidity, market cap, volume, socials, age, team) - üî¨ Wallet Forensics via Helius API (deployer analysis, risk flags) - üìã Listing Pipeline Management (READY / NEEDS_REVIEW / REJECTED) ### Plugin Structure - 4 Actions: SCAN_TOKENS, SCORE_TOKEN, CHECK_WALLET, SUBMIT_LISTING_INQUIRY - 2 Providers: pipelineStatus, marketIntel - 1 Evaluator: listingReadiness ### Evidence - Published on npm: v1.0.0 - Live tested: BONK scored 92/100 (87 base + 5 wallet adjustment) - Screenshots in repo: assets/screenshots/ - Branding assets: assets/logo.png, assets/banner.png

Greptile Summary

Registers the new `@buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd` plugin (SolCex Exchange BD) in the ElizaOS plugin registry by adding a single entry to `index.json` pointing to `github:buzzbysolcex/plugin-solcex-bd`. - New entry `"@buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd": "github:buzzbysolcex/plugin-solcex-bd"` is placed in correct alphabetical order - The file was reformatted from 3-space to 2-space indentation, inflating the diff to touch all 244 lines despite only 1 line being logically added - A pre-existing sort order issue with `@elizaos/plugin-ATTPs` was incidentally fixed - JSON remains valid and no existing entries were modified or removed

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is safe to merge ‚Äî it adds a single registry entry with no functional risk. - The actual change is minimal (one new key-value pair in a JSON registry file). The entry follows the correct format and alphabetical ordering. The only concern is the unnecessary whitespace reformatting that makes the diff noisy, but verified analysis confirms no entries were removed or modified. - No files require special attention. The whitespace reformatting in `index.json` was verified to contain no hidden changes beyond the new entry and sort fix.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Adds `@buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd` plugin entry in correct alphabetical order. Also reformats entire file from 3-space to 2-space indentation and fixes pre-existing sort order of `@elizaos/plugin-ATTPs`. JSON is valid. |

Flowchart

```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'neutral'}}%% flowchart TD A["PR: Add @buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd"] --> B["index.json updated"] B --> C["New entry added:\n@buzzbd/plugin-solcex-bd\n‚Üí github:buzzbysolcex/plugin-solcex-bd"] B --> D["CI: generate-registry-json workflow"] D --> E["Reads index.json"] E --> F["Fetches GitHub repo info\n+ npm metadata"] F --> G["Generates generated-registry.json\nwith version support flags"] G --> H["Auto-commits to main"] ``` Last reviewed commit: 4050479 (3/5) Reply to the agent's comments like "Can you suggest a fix for this @greptileai?" or ask follow-up questions!

topPRs.title: ci: fix claude-review on fork PRs
topPRs.author: kamiyo-ai
topPRs.body:
The current claude-review workflow fails on fork-based PRs with: "Could not fetch an OIDC token".\n\nThis switches the trigger to pull_request_target so OIDC + repo secrets are available, while checkout remains on the base ref (actions/checkout default behavior for pull_request_target), avoiding execution of untrusted PR code.\n\nAlso grants the action the write permissions it needs to post review feedback. ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Chores** * Expanded CI workflow triggers to include additional pull request events (including reopened). * Elevated workflow permissions for pull requests and issues to enable more actions. * Improved checkout behavior to use base commit references and avoid persisting credentials. * Minor formatting cleanup in the workflow file.

Greptile Summary

This PR fixes the Claude Code Review workflow failing on fork-based PRs by switching the trigger from `pull_request` to `pull_request_target`, which grants access to OIDC tokens and repository secrets. It also upgrades `pull-requests` and `issues` permissions from `read` to `write` (needed for posting review comments), and adds the `reopened` event type. - **Security model is sound in principle**: The `actions/checkout@v4` step without an explicit `ref` defaults to the base branch under `pull_request_target`, avoiding checkout of untrusted fork code while secrets are available. - **Verify `claude-code-action` fetches PR diff via API**: The checkout is the base branch (main), so if the action relies on local file diffs rather than the GitHub API to read PR changes, the review would not see the actual PR content. This should be confirmed. - The `reopened` event type addition is a minor but useful improvement ensuring reviews re-trigger on reopened PRs.

Confidence Score: 3/5

- This PR is likely safe to merge but has a functional concern that should be verified before merging. - The security model of using `pull_request_target` with a base-branch checkout is the correct pattern. However, it's unclear whether `claude-code-action` will still be able to review the actual PR changes when the checkout is the base branch (main) rather than the PR head. If the action relies on local git state to compute diffs, the review would be non-functional. The permissions and event type changes are straightforward and correct. - `.github/workflows/claude-code-review.yml` ‚Äî verify that `claude-code-action@beta` fetches PR diffs via GitHub API and does not depend on local checkout containing the PR code.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | .github/workflows/claude-code-review.yml | Switches trigger from `pull_request` to `pull_request_target` for OIDC/secrets access on fork PRs, upgrades `pull-requests` and `issues` permissions to `write`, and adds `reopened` event type. The checkout defaults to base ref, which is the correct secure pattern for `pull_request_target`. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Fork as Fork PR Author participant GH as GitHub participant WF as Workflow (pull_request_target) participant CO as actions/checkout@v4 participant CCA as claude-code-action@beta Fork->>GH: Opens/synchronizes PR from fork GH->>WF: Triggers pull_request_target event Note over WF: Secrets & OIDC token available WF->>CO: Checkout (default: base branch) Note over CO: Checks out main (NOT PR head) CO-->>WF: Base branch code on disk WF->>CCA: Run Claude Code Review Note over CCA: Reads PR diff via GitHub API?
Or from local checkout? CCA->>GH: Posts review comments (write permission) GH-->>Fork: Review visible on PR ``` Last reviewed commit: 00c202a (3/5) Reply to the agent's comments like "Can you suggest a fix for this @greptileai?" or ask follow-up questions!

topPRs.title: Add @elizaos/plugin-buzz-bd
topPRs.author: buzzbysolcex
topPRs.body:
## Plugin: @elizaos/plugin-buzz-bd Autonomous BD intelligence from Buzz BD Agent ‚Äî 15-source token scoring, AIXBT momentum, wallet forensics, and listing pipeline for the elizaOS agent ecosystem. **Repository:** https://github.com/buzzbysolcex/plugin-buzz-bd **Actions (4):** - BUZZ_TOKEN_INTELLIGENCE ‚Äî Full token analysis with 15-source cross-reference - BUZZ_LISTING_PROSPECTS ‚Äî Current hot prospects from BD pipeline - BUZZ_AGENT_STATUS ‚Äî Operational health and ERC-8004 info - BUZZ_MOMENTUM_SCAN ‚Äî AIXBT trending tokens and surge detection **Identity:** ERC-8004 registered ‚Äî Ethereum #25045, Base #17483 **Operator:** SolCex Exchange **Infrastructure:** Akash Network (24/7) **Assets:** logo.jpg (400x400) + banner.jpg (1280x640) included ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * A new plugin has been added to the plugin registry and is now available for installation and use.

Greptile Summary

This PR registers a new community plugin `@elizaos/plugin-buzz-bd` by adding a single entry to `index.json` pointing to the `buzzbysolcex/plugin-buzz-bd` GitHub repository. - Adds `"@elizaos/plugin-buzz-bd": "github:buzzbysolcex/plugin-buzz-bd"` to the plugin registry - Entry is correctly placed in alphabetical order between `plugin-browser` and `plugin-cardano` - Follows the established `github:owner/repo` format convention used by all other entries - JSON structure remains valid with no syntax issues - No naming conflicts with existing plugins in the registry

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is a minimal, low-risk registry addition that follows established conventions. - The change is a single-line addition to a JSON registry file. The entry follows the correct format, is alphabetically ordered, and introduces no conflicts. The only reason this is not a 5 is that external plugin repositories should ideally be verified for valid package.json and elizaOS core compatibility before merging, which is outside the scope of this diff review. - No files require special attention. The external repository `buzzbysolcex/plugin-buzz-bd` should be verified for a valid package.json with an `@elizaos/core` dependency.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Adds a single new entry `@elizaos/plugin-buzz-bd` pointing to `github:buzzbysolcex/plugin-buzz-bd`. The entry is correctly placed in alphabetical order, follows the `github:owner/repo` format convention, and the JSON remains valid. |

Flowchart

```mermaid flowchart TD A["PR: Add plugin-buzz-bd to index.json"] --> B["index.json updated"] B --> C["CI: generate-registry.js runs"] C --> D["Fetches GitHub repo info\nbuzzbysolcex/plugin-buzz-bd"] C --> E["Fetches npm metadata\n@elizaos/plugin-buzz-bd"] C --> F["Reads package.json\nfrom repo branches"] D --> G["Determines version support\nv0 / v1 compatibility"] E --> G F --> G G --> H["generated-registry.json\nupdated with full metadata"] ``` Last reviewed commit: e725cc2 (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
